title: "The Philosophy of Energy and Alchemy: Techniques and Symbols"
first_phrase: This text speaks about the concept of "philosophical egg," which represents the starting point for reaching a state of non-duality through the elevation of energy levels. The egg contains the elements prepared in the preceding stages, and the process involves complete reintegration. After twenty-one days, the chick hatches. The function of this stage is compared to sexual intercourse, and various energetic-magnetic techniques can be used for successful vivification. The last 200 tokens explain the techniques of developing an excess of nervous potential through the use of two vessels and the development of "fermentation" in vital energy-based techniques.

Uovo è sinonimo in generale di vaso, cioè dell’uomo, ma in questa fase il simbolismo può fare anche riferimento alla congiunzione di sole e luna che genera l’uomo completo (vedi l’immagine, dove ai piedi di sole e luna vi è un gallo ed una gallina). Ma in pratica tutte le metodiche energetico-magnetiche basate sull’energia vitale possono avere utilizzo con successo. E’ da queste tecniche di vivificazione energetica che è derivato il moderno “magnetismo” e tecniche correlate. Nell’uovo filosofico deve essere introdotto il soggetto dell’opera “liberato da ogni corpo estraneo” (cioè deve aver effettuato una purificazione preliminare). Tecniche a due vasi e lo sviluppo del “fermento” nelle tecniche basate sull’”energia vitale” Sviluppare un’eccedenza di potenziale nervoso richiede impegno. Tuttavia, poiché vi sia un’eccedenza vi sono sempre due termini, l’assorbente e l’emettente.
last_phrase: In summary, the philosophical egg represents the purification of the subject and the generation of a complete individual through the conjunction of the sun and moon. Techniques based on vital energy can successfully be used for energetic vivification, including modern magnetism. Developing a surplus of nervous potential requires effort, but it involves both absorbing and emitting terms. The historical development of magnetic inductions can be traced back to previous alchemical practices that operated on the active and passive elements of the human consciousness. Simplifying the procedure, the two vases represent the two individuals: the operator who is always active and the subject who is passive. Practically speaking, the two vases allow for a more efficient operation.
